Officials: Salem mother slashed children's throats

Tanicia Goodwin is due to be arraigned today. On Sunday, firefighters found Goodwin's two wounded children inside a burning apartment. (AP, 6:38 a.m.)

Gunman kills 4 at France Jewish school

A motorcycle gunman opened fire in front of a Jewish school in Toulouse, killing a father, his two sons, and one other child, the prosecutor's office said. (AP, 6:49 a.m.)

Urgent care centers increase

A national company, Doctors Express, plans to open 19 urgent care centers in Eastern Massachusetts that would treat patients at nights and on weekends.

Mass. tech start-ups excel at SXSW

Cambridge companies took three of the top six prizes in a competition for start-ups last week at the South by Southwest Interactive Festival.

Vaccines by skin may work better

Scientists say applying vaccines to the upper layers of the skin could stimulate a more powerful immune system response than injecting a vaccine into muscle.

Syrian troops, gunmen clash

Security forces clashed Monday with gunmen in a Damascus neighborhood that is home to embassies and senior officials in one of the worst confrontations in the tightly-controlled city center in the country's yearlong uprising.
